contentrichtext.text: '''Richard de Clare''' may refer to: *[[Richard fitz Gilbert]] (died 1090), lord of Clare and of Tonbridge, ancestor of the Clare family. *[[Richard fitz Gilbert de Clare]] (d. 15 April 1136), Anglo-Norman lord *[[Richard de Clare, 1st Earl of Hertford]] (1094–1136), Anglo-Norman lord *[[Richard de Clare, 2nd Earl of Pembroke]] (1130–1176), Cambro-Norman lord known as "Strongbow" *[[Richard de Clare, 3rd Earl of Hertford]] (1162–1218), known as Earl of Clare, led in negotiations for the Magna Carta *[[Richard de Clare, 5th Earl of Hertford]] (1222–1262), also 2nd Earl of Gloucester *[[Richard de Clare, Steward of Forest of Essex]] (1278–1318), killed at the Battle of Dysert O'Dea in Ireland ==See also== * [[de Clare]] {{hndis|De Clare, Richard}}
